sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 24 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C24, the alternating group A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 24. Determine if G is isomorphic to one of the following: C24, A5, or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24.
message_2:
To determine if G is isomorphic to one of the given groups, we will analyze the possible structures of G using the Sylow Theorems.

The order of G is 24, which has prime factorization 2^3 * 3. By the Sylow Theorems, we know that the number of Sylow 2-subgroups (n_2) divides 3 and is congruent to 1 mod 2, so n_2 can be 1 or 3. Similarly, the number of Sylow 3-subgroups (n_3) divides 8 and is congruent to 1 mod 3, so n_3 can be 1 or 4.

Case 1: n_2 = 1 and n_3 = 1
In this case, there is a unique Sylow 2-subgroup P and a unique Sylow 3-subgroup Q. Both P and Q are normal in G since they are unique. The order of P is 8 and the order of Q is 3. Since the orders of P and Q are coprime, G is isomorphic to the direct product of P and Q, which is C_8 x C_3 = C_24. So G can be isomorphic to C24.

Case 2: n_2 = 3 and n_3 = 1
In this case, there is a unique Sylow 3-subgroup Q, which is normal in G. The Sylow 2-subgroups are not normal. We can use the semidirect product to analyze the possible structures of G. Since there are two automorphisms of Q, there are two non-isomorphic semidirect products, which correspond to two non-abelian groups of order 24.

Case 3: n_2 = 1 and n_3 = 4
This case is similar to Case 2, but with the roles of the Sylow 2-subgroup and Sylow 3-subgroup reversed. There are three automorphisms of the Sylow 2-subgroup, so there are three non-isomorphic semidirect products, which correspond to three non-abelian groups of order 24.

Case 4: n_2 = 3 and n_3 = 4
In this case, neither the Sylow 2-subgroups nor the Sylow 3-subgroups are normal in G. This case does not lead to any new groups that we have not already considered.

In conclusion, G can be isomorphic to C24 or one of the five non-abelian groups of order 24. However, G cannot be isomorphic to A5, since A5 has order 60, not 24.
